summary: This bill, the "Defense of Conscience in Health Care Act," introduced in the House of Representatives, mandates that the Secretary of Health and Human Services issue a final rule, within six months of enactment, that is identical or materially equivalent to a former rule (from July 22, 2019) related to protecting statutory conscience rights in healthcare. This new rule would supersede any conflicting existing rules. The bill centers on defining and protecting rights related to conscientious objection in a healthcare setting.
